dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 3109 IH: Researching Efficient Federal Improvements for Necessary Energy Refining Act

action.action-desc: Mr. Latta introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To require the Secretary of Energy to direct the National Petroleum Council to issue a report with respect to petrochemical refineries in the United States, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Researching Efficient Federal Improvements for Necessary Energy Refining Act or the REFINER Act.
Not later than 90 days after the date of enactment of this section, the Secretary of Energy shall direct the National Petroleum Council to—

paragraph.text: submit to the Secretary of Energy and Congress a report containing—

subparagraph.text: an examination of the role of petrochemical refineries located in the United States and the contributions of such petrochemical refineries to the energy security of the United States, including the reliability of supply in the United States of liquid fuels and feedstocks, and the affordability of liquid fuels for consumers in the United States;
analyses and projections with respect to—

clause.text: the capacity of petrochemical refineries located in the United States;
opportunities for expanding such capacity; and
the risks to petrochemical refineries located in the United States;

subparagraph.text: an assessment of any Federal or State executive actions, regulations, or policies that have caused or contributed to a decline in the capacity of petrochemical refineries located in the United States; and
any recommendations for Federal agencies and Congress to encourage an increase in the capacity of petrochemical refineries located in the United States; and

paragraph.text: make publicly available the report submitted under paragraph (1).
